title: McDonald's staff reveal secrets to saving money, getting fresh food - and VIP service
text:
Get the most from your McDonald's experience (Photo: PA) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Everyone loves a bit of insider knowledge. 
Especially when said knowledge has the ability to enhance your fast food dining experience , elevating it from the mundane to the extraordinary. 
Who could resist that? No one. 
Now, thanks to some caring and sharing McDonald's employees, there is a way you can ensure you get the best of everything. 
The freshest fries, the fastest service - even the nicest egg in your burger. You name it (within reason), thanks to a very informative Quora conversation, it's yours for the taking. 1. Can't decide if you fancy breakfast or lunch? 
"Go between 10.30 and 11. They're transitioning from breakfast to lunch, and you can get a little of both. It's like brunch for your stomach," advised Matt Decuir. McDonalds breakfast (Photo: McDonalds) 2. Avoid stale fries. 
Both Mackenzie Shelton and Julie H. Park say if you order fries without salt, you'll get a portion from a fresh batch. 
Words to bear in mind, however, come from Chuck Chan, who added: 
"The fry person will need to wipe down the station, the fry scoop, and clear the area for the new batch to keep salt from contaminating the new batch. The fry person might not even fill up your container as full due to this fuss. Make stale fries a thing of the past (Photo: Getty) 
"And if any fries fall out of the bag/container, they wont put more in because the rest of the fries may have already been salted." 
You have been warned. 3. And stale burgers. 
"Always ask for your burger without some ingredient. Like a Quarter Pounder with no pickles," explains Ted Pettiy. 
"They will write this on a small slip of paper, put it on the tray under the heat lamps and say 'Grill up!' to the cooks. Read More There's a secret meaning behind McDonald's Golden Arches - and it's all to do with your mum If you order your burger without a few key ingredients, it could make all the difference (Photo: Getty) 
"They will look at it and make you one right then and there. When it's done, the cook will say 'Grill Up!' and the counter person will retrieve your fresh Quarter Pounder. 
"The difference in taste between a burger that's sitting for who knows how long and one right off the grill is phenomenal." 4. Get the most for your money. 
A worker who wished to remain anonymous had some excellent pointers for saving money, though the first one is bit naughty. A McDonald's Egg McMuffin and hash browns (Photo: Getty Images) 
"When you buy a hot drink, you can ask for a free refill once. 
"Suppose if you want to buy a promotional hot drink which costs more than Â£2, then just buy any hot drink (hot chocolate, latte, white coffee) which ever is the cheapest, drink it and then ask them for refill, they will ask you what drink you want, then just say the name of the promotional drink." 
Don't get ripped off with your hash brown, either. 
"When you buy a breakfast meal, if you buy extra hash brown, there is an option on the till machine called 'Uplift Hash Brown', we are guided to add extra hash brown which costs 70 - 80 pence each. Read More What's in a Chicken McNugget? New 'clean' recipe reveals something troubling about the ingredients McDonald's: Where the money-saving possibilities are endless (Photo: AFP) 
"But ethically we should press Uplift Hash Brown which costs 30 pence. So if you are aware, you can ask them that you have bought a meal so you should get extra hash brown for 30 pence." Also, did you know, if you are a police officer, work in hospital, also fire brigade, you can ask for an employee meal which is nearly half price. 5. And actual eggs. 
"If you want real eggs on your breakfast sandwiches instead of the liquid stuff, you can put a round egg onto any breakfast sandwich. They use a special sort of egg in the McMuffin (Photo: Getty Images) 
"Just ask for a 'round egg' on it (same egg they use on McMuffins)." 6. Something for all the parents out there. 
Jeremy Young had some words of comfort for any mums and dads who'd been dragged to McDonald's by their enthusiastic offsrping. 
"A Happy Meal plus a coffee costs almost nothing (i.e. basic hack - don't buy yourself any food) 
"The pointless safety warnings for the Happy Meal toy, which normally get thrown away are actually a modern day Rosetta stone, with translations into dozens of different languages. Read More McDonald's "disgusting" dunking advice has fast food lovers divided - where do you stand? A Happy Meal is displayed for a photograph on a tray at a McDonald's (Photo: Getty Images) 
"So, while your child eats the nasty food, you can spend a nerdish 15 minutes drinking coffee and comparing Croatian and Serbian, trying to figure out which Asian language is which, or classifying European languages according to their rendering of 'risk of choking.'" 
Niche advice, but useful nonetheless. 7. Last of all... 
If you request a receipt, employees will think you're a secret shopper, so they'll serve you the freshest food - and quickly too. But the best way to guarantee a good experience? 
"Be kind! I promise you, the teenager (such as myself) behind the counter will appreciate you more and you might just make their day at a crummy fast food job that much better. 
You're also much more likely to get better food quality and save a few cents here and there if we like you." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
